hevs.gdx2d.lib

Class GdxGraphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • hevs.gdx2d.lib.GdxGraphics

  • public class GdxGraphics
extends java.lang.Object
    A game graphics implementation for LibGDX based on the interface of FunGraphics for INF1 class given at the UAS Western Switzerland, Sion.

    The objective of this implementation is to provide a simple, yet powerful, set of graphics primitives used for the projects that take place in this course.

    Comments are welcome !

    Version:
    1.61
    Author:
    Pierre-André Mudry (mui), Nils Chatton (chn), Christopher Métrailler (mei)

        public void drawFPS()
        Draws frame per second (FPS) information in the bottom left corner of the screen. The default Color#WHITE color is used.

      • drawAntiAliasedCircle

        public void drawAntiAliasedCircle(float centerX,
                         float centerY,
                         float radius,
                         Color c)
        Draws an anti-aliased circle (with nice border without jaggies). However, the performance for drawing such circles is still pretty slow. You should avoid this method when you have many circles to draw.
        Parameters:
        centerX - Center x position of the circle to draw
        centerY - Center y position of the circle to draw
        radius - The radius of the circle
        c - The Color to use

      • drawFilledCircle

        public void drawFilledCircle(float centerX,
                    float centerY,
                    float radius,
                    Color c)
        Draws a filled circle with a given color. Depending on the size of the radius, either a texture is drawn or a "real" circle. This method goes fast.
        Parameters:
        centerX - Center x position of the circle to draw
        centerY - Center y position of the circle to draw
        radius - The radius of the circle
        c - The Color to use

      • drawFilledBorderedCircle

        public void drawFilledBorderedCircle(float centerX,
                            float centerY,
                            float radius,
                            Color inner,
                            Color outer)
        Draws a filled circle with a border. However, this does not work really well as of now. This should be improved in a future version of the libary.
        Parameters:
        centerX - Center x position of the circle to draw
        centerY - Center y position of the circle to draw
        radius - The radius of the circle to be drawn. Note that the actual circle has a radius which is 3 pixels larger
        inner - The inner Color (used for inside the circle)s
        outer - The outer Color (used for the border)

      • drawString

        public void drawString(float posX,
              float posY,
              java.lang.String str)
        Draws a text at a specified position.

        The default font type and font size is used and the text is left aligned. The text position reference is the top left corner.

        Parameters:
        posX - Left position of the text, in pixels
        posY - Top position of the text, in pixels
        str - The text to display on the screen
        See Also:
        #drawString(float, float, String, BitmapFont, int)} for more options

      • drawString

        public void drawString(float posX,
              float posY,
              java.lang.String str,
              BitmapFont f)
        Draws a text with a specific font at a specified position. Default alignement is left.

        The text position reference is the top left edge.

        Parameters:
        posX - left position of the text
        posY - Y top position of the text
        str - the text to display
        f - the custom font to use

      • drawString

        public void drawString(float posX,
              float posY,
              java.lang.String str,
              BitmapFont f,
              int align)
        Draws a text with a specific font at a specified position. Can be left, right or center aligned.

        The text position reference is the top left edge.

        Parameters:
        posX - left, right or center position of the text
        posY - Y top position of the text
        str - the text to display
        f - the custom font to use
        align - left, center or right align

      • drawStringCentered

        public void drawStringCentered(float posY,
                      java.lang.String str)
        Draws a text in the middle of the screen.

        The default font type and font size is used.

        Parameters:
        posY - Y top position of the text
        str - the text to display

      • drawStringCentered

                      BitmapFont f)
        Draws a text in the middle of the screen with a specific font.
        Parameters:

        str - the text to display
        f - the custom BitmapFont to use

      • drawTransformedPicture

        public void drawTransformedPicture(float posX,
                          float posY,
                          float angle,
                          float scale,
                          BitmapImage bitmap)
        Draws a picture at position (posX, posY). Center of rotation is located in the middle of the image.
        Parameters:
        posX -
        posY -
        angle -
        scale -
        bitmap -

      • drawTransformedPicture

        public void drawTransformedPicture(float posX,
                          float posY,
                          float angle,
                          float width,
                          float height,
                          BitmapImage bitmap)
        Draws a picture at position (posX, posY) with a fixed width and height (not the one of the BitmapImage itself).
        Parameters:
        posX - The x position at which we want to display the image
        posY - The y position at which we want to display the image
        angle - The image can be rotated by this angle (in degrees)
        width - The width of the resulting image (which will be scaled for display)
        height - The height of the resulting image
        bitmap - The BitmapImage to use

      • drawTransformedPicture

        public void drawTransformedPicture(float posX,
                          float posY,
                          float centerX,
                          float centerY,
                          float angle,
                          float scale,
                          BitmapImage bitmap)
        Draws a picture at position (posX, posY) with a selectable center of rotation which is located at position offset by ( centerX, centerY).
        Parameters:
        posX - The x position at which we want to display the image
        posY - The y position at which we want to display the image
        centerX - The x position of the rotation center
        centerY - The y position of the rotation center
        angle - The angle of rotation of the displayed image, in degrees
        scale - The scale factor of the image. 1.0 is the default value
        bitmap - The BitmapImage to use

      • drawAlphaPicture

        public void drawAlphaPicture(Vector2 pos,
                    float alpha,
                    BitmapImage img)
        Draws a picture at position pos with a selectable alpha (transparency). See drawAlphaPicture(float, float, float, float, float, float, float, BitmapImage)
        Parameters:
        pos - The Vector2 position at which we want to display the image
        alpha - The alpha value to use. 0.0 is completely transparent, 1.0 is opaque
        img - The BitmapImage to use

      • drawAlphaPicture

        public void drawAlphaPicture(float posX,
                    float posY,
                    float scale,
                    float alpha,
                    BitmapImage img)

        Draws the currently assigned shader
        Parameters:
        shaderTime - The current time that is passed to the fragment shader

      • drawShader

        public void drawShader(int posX,
              int posY,
              float shaderTime)
        Request shader rendering that passes an uniform value with the current rendering location.
        Parameters:
        posX - The value passed to the shader, might be discarded
        posY - The value passed to the shader, might be discarded
        shaderTime - The value passed to the shader, might be discarded

      • setShader

        public void setShader(java.lang.String s)
        Sets a shader that will be drawable
        Parameters:
        s - The path of the shader file

      • setShader

        public void setShader(java.lang.String s,
             int width,
             int height)
        Sets a shader that will be drawn
        Parameters:
        s - The path of the shader
        height - The height of the texture to draw the shader on
        width - The width of the texture to draw the shader on
